fields.name: RSEs have the skills and knowledge required for their role
Identify the baseline skills required for RSEs at different levels of experience
fields.description: Identify the baseline skills required for RSEs at different levels of experience. This will help to define the competencies required for RSEs at different levels of experience.

fields.name: Identify the most appropriate training opportunities for RSEs at different levels of experience
fields.description: Identify the most appropriate training opportunities for RSEs at different levels of experience. This will help RSEs to develop the skills and knowledge required for their role.

fields.name: Evidence 1
fields.description: [Goldacre](https://assets.publishing.service.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/1067053/goldacre-review-using-health-data-for-research-and-analysis.pdf)

fields.name: skills-and-training.md
fields.description: RSEs may struggle to identify the most appropriate training opportunities for their role. This links to the ambiguity of the RSE role and the lack of a clear career path. This can also result in issues of skills shortages.

fields.name: recruitment-to-rse.md
fields.description: RSEs may find it difficult to attract new talent to the field, as the role of RSE is not always well-understood or recognised. This can make it difficult to recruit new staff or to build a diverse team.

fields.name: RSEs are recognised as key contributors to research
Non standard research outputs inc. software produced by RSEs to be recognised as academic output.
Evidence 2
fields.description: [from-backstage-to-spotlight-a-call-to-highlight-the-critical-role-of-research-software](https://blogs.lse.ac.uk/impactofsocialsciences/2023/09/07/from-backstage-to-spotlight-a-call-to-highlight-the-critical-role-of-research-software/)

fields.name: Evidence 3
fields.description: [Research technology professionals: the hidden roles behind research success](https://www.ses.ac.uk/research-technology-professionals-the-hidden-roles-behind-research-success/)

fields.name: recognition.md
fields.description:
RSEs often struggle to get recognition for their work. This can be due to a lack of understanding of the role of RSEs, or a lack of visibility of their contributions. RSEs may also find it difficult to get credit for their work, as they are often not listed as authors on academic papers.
There needs to be recognition of the different kinds of roles that RSEs play in research, and the importance of their work in enabling research to be carried out. RSEs should be recognised as key contributors to research, and their work should be valued and rewarded accordingly.

fields.name: project-management.md
fields.description: RSEs often need to contribute to multiple projects simultaneously. This can lead to issues with prioritisation, time management, and workload management.

fields.name: other_notes.md
RSEs have limited stress and anxiety levels during and outside of work
Establish a mental health support network for RSEs
fields.description: Identify and establish a mental health support network for RSEs, where they can seek help and support when needed.

fields.name: A mental health support network for RSEs
Understand the scale of the problem of mental health in the RSE community
fields.description: This objective will result in a better understanding of the scale of the problem of mental health in the RSE community.

fields.name: RSEs have a community to turn to to support them through mental health challenges
fields.description: This objective will result in RSEs having a community to turn to for support when they are experiencing mental health challenges.

fields.name: Evidence 4
fields.description: [Talking about mental health at RSECon22](https://www.software.ac.uk/blog/talking-about-mental-health-rsecon22)

fields.name: mental-health.md
fields.description: RSEs may experience high levels of stress and anxiety due to the demands of their work. This can have a negative impact on their mental health and well-being.

fields.name: Evidence 5
fields.description: [Open source research software project life cycles: understanding project maturity successes, and challenge events](https://talks.cam.ac.uk/talk/index/219982)

fields.name: maintaining-legacy-code.md
fields.description: RSEs often need to work with legacy code, which can be challenging. This can be due to a lack of documentation, a lack of understanding of the codebase, or a lack of support from the original developers. This is particularly challenging when the original developers may have had limited experience in software development.

fields.name: Reduce the environmental impact of RSEs through their work
Raise awareness of the environmental impact of RSEs and the importance of adopting sustainable practices
Create a Green RSE SIG
fields.description:
This action will be achieved by creating a Green RSE SIG.
Some more text

fields.name: Life cycle assessment
fields.description: We will develop a life cycle assessment tool for RSEs to use to assess the environmental impact of their work.

fields.name: An SIG dedicated to the green RSE initiative
A person to lead the Green RSE SIG
A tool that calculates the life cycle impact of your work
Develop a set of best practices for RSEs to reduce their environmental impact
fields.description: This objective will be achieved by creating a set of best practices for RSEs to follow in order to reduce their environmental impact. This will be achieved by creating a Green RSE SIG.

fields.name: Encourage green rse champions within RSE groups to promote sustainable practices
Improve transparency of RSE impact on the environment
Evidence 6
fields.description: [UK Gov Office for Science: Large-scale computing: the case for greater UK coordination](https://assets.publishing.service.gov.uk/media/654a4025e2e16a000d42aaef/UK_Computing_report_-_Final_20.09.21.pdf)

fields.name: green-rse.md
fields.description: The environmental impact of RSEs through their work is a growing concern. RSEs need to consider the environmental impact of their work and adopt sustainable practices where possible.

fields.name: A diverse and inclusive RSE community
Everyone feels welcomed and supported by the RSE community
The RSE community is representative of the wider research community
Create or adapt guidance on inclusive language
fields.description: Create or adapt guidance on inclusive language

fields.name: A shared agreement of inclusive language in the RSE community
Understand the scale of the problem of diversity in RSE teams and the community
fields.description:
This objective will begin to understand the scale of the problem of diversity in RSE teams and the community.
It will help to support further work into this area.

fields.name: Identify the barriers to entry for underrepresented groups in the RSE community
fields.description: This objective will identify the barriers to entry for underrepresented groups in the RSE community.

fields.name: More representative RSE leaders and role models
fields.description:
This objective will ensure that the RSE community has more representative leaders and role models.
This will lead to increased diversity and inclusivity in the RSE community.

fields.name: More inclusive and diverse RSE teams
fields.description: This objective will ensure that RSE teams are more inclusive and diverse.

fields.name: More inclusive and diverse Events and Conferences
fields.description: This objective will ensure that events and conferences are more inclusive and diverse.

fields.name: equality-diversity-inclusion-accessibility.md
fields.description: The RSE community faces challenges of inclusivity and diversity. This can be due to a lack of awareness of the role of RSEs, or a lack of opportunities for underrepresented groups to enter the field.

fields.name: RSEs have a strong community to support each other, share knowledge and best practices, and advocate for the profession
Document the existing RSE communities
fields.description: This action will result in a comprehensive list of the existing RSE communities and their activities.

fields.name: A list of the existing RSE communities hosted on the RSE Soc website
Identify the existing RSE communities
fields.description: This objective will result in a better understanding of the existing RSE communities and how they can be leveraged to support the RSE profession.

fields.name: community.md
fields.description: Community is key to the success of the RSE profession. It is important to have a strong community to support each other, share knowledge and best practices, and advocate for the profession. However, building and maintaining a strong community can be challenging. This challenge is about identifying the key issues that the RSE community faces and developing strategies to overcome them.

fields.name: RSEs feel they are in a role that reflects their experience and expertise
RSEs feel they are renumerated fairly for their work
Share examples of career paths for RSEs
fields.description: This action will be achieved by sharing examples of career paths for RSEs.

fields.name: Improve availability of career paths to RSEs
A clear implementation of an RSE career path
fields.description: This objective will be achieved by evidencing a clear career path from entry level to senior RSE and examples of it being implemented from start to finish.

fields.name: Evidence 7
fields.description: [SSI A not-so-brief history of Research Software Engineers](https://www.software.ac.uk/blog/not-so-brief-history-research-software-engineers-0)

fields.name: Evidence 8
fields.description: [Why it’s so difficult to define an RSE career path CW 24](https://www.software.ac.uk/blog/why-its-so-difficult-define-rse-career-path)

fields.name: Evidence 9
fields.description: [Identifying the Foundational Competencies of a Research Software Engineer](https://www.software.ac.uk/blog/identifying-foundational-competencies-research-software-engineer)

fields.name: careers.md
fields.description: RSEs may find it difficult to progress in their careers, as the role of RSE is not always well-defined within academic institutions. This can make it difficult for RSEs to advance to more senior positions or plan for their future career development.

fields.name: Research software is of a high quality, maintainable, and scalable
Research software results are reproducible or replicable
Establish RSE champions in key areas of software best practice
fields.description: Identify RSE champions in key areas of software best practice, who can lead the community in adopting best practices.

fields.name: RSEs with the skills, knowleddge and resources to lead the community
Understand the scale of the problem of best practices in research software development
fields.description: This objective will result in a better understanding of the scale of the problem of best practices in research software development.

fields.name: RSEs have the skills, knowledge and resources to implement best practices in research software development
fields.description: This objective will result in RSEs having the skills, knowledge and resources to implement best practices in research software development.

fields.name: Best practice is shared and adopted across the RSE community
fields.description: This objective will result in best practice being shared and adopted across the RSE community.

fields.name: best-practice-software-development.md
fields.description: RSEs may struggle to implement best practices in software development, due to a lack of training or experience in this area. This can lead to issues with code quality, maintainability, and scalability. This is a particular challenge when working with researchers who may not have a background in software development.
